items.summary: IndiGo is facing significant flight cancellations and delays impacting hundreds of passengers. The airline's CEO has stated that normalizing operations and restoring punctuality are immediate, challenging goals. items.title: S&P upgrades India’s insolvency framework to Group B amid stronger creditor protection
items.summary: Despite the upgrade, S&P cautioned that India’s insolvency framework still trails more mature systems in Group A and several jurisdictions within Group B.

items.summary: Amazon also announced a major education initiative aimed at expanding AI literacy and career awareness to 4 million government-school students by 2030 through an AI curriculum, hands-on experiments, teacher training, and career tours

The company plans to develop future-ready projects, strengthening its presence in the growing Hyderabad market. Brigade Enterprises has a strong track record in real estate development across India.

items.title: IndiGo has faced tough moments before, will overcome this challenge too: CEO Pieter Elbers writes to staff

items.title: Supreme Court clears restart of Noida Sports City, giving relief to 40,000 homebuyers
items.summary: The ambitious Noida Sports City projects are set to restart, thanks to a favorable Supreme Court ruling. This is fantastic news for around 40,000 homebuyers who have been eagerly awaiting their dream homes. The Noida Authority will lift current restrictions in the next 30 to 45 days.

items.title: Diesel consumption hits six-month high driven by GST rate cuts, higher industrial offtake

items.summary: India’s automobile sector has surged to the world’s No.3 spot and could become No.1 within a few years, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari told Parliament. With expanding EV adoption, alternative fuels and a growing manufacturing base, the industry is positioned for explosive growth through the decade.

items.title: India bonds slip on muddled policy bets; benchmark up on liquidity hopes

Both nations are eager to uncover fresh opportunities for partnership, particularly in transformative connectivity initiatives. The agenda is rich with discussions aimed at boosting trade and diversifying their economic ties.

items.title: Falling rupee makes imports costlier, fuels inflation: Experts
items.summary: The Indian rupee recently fell below the 90-mark against the US dollar, sparking concerns from opposition parties and raising questions about the impact on ordinary citizens. Experts noted that a weaker rupee benefits exporters and the IT sector by improving competitiveness but makes imports costlier, fueling inflation and squeezing corporate margins.

Discussions are focused on expanding Indian exports, particularly in pharmaceuticals, agricultural goods, and automobiles. This visit is expected to open new avenues for Indian businesses in the Russian market. Agreements in shipping, healthcare, and connectivity are anticipated. The collaboration will also strengthen people-to-people ties and scientific exchange.

items.summary: Ridham Desai of Morgan Stanley India forecasts a potential rebound for the Indian stock market in 2026, driven by strong macro factors and earnings growth. However, he warns that a global slowdown remains the biggest risk.&nbsp;

items.summary: India is poised to become the world's largest market for Scotch whisky. A new trade agreement between India and the UK is expected to lower import duties. This will make Scotch more affordable for Indian consumers. The deal is also anticipated to boost jobs and investment in both countries. Indian companies are showing interest in Scottish distilleries.

Russia also sees potential for India to increase supplies in agriculture, pharma, and telecom.

The nation's tea exports to China saw a significant increase from USD 20 million last year to USD 37 million in the first ten months of this year, indicating a rising demand beyond traditional green teas.

The panel ordered Star Health and Allied Insurance to pay nearly Rs 50,000 with interest and litigation costs for rejecting a Covid-related claim. The insurer had denied the claim, citing home isolation as appropriate, but the commission found this a deficiency in service.

The order, issued by a Division Bench, comes as Eros seeks to enforce a ₹28-crore arbitral award against 14 Reels Entertainment. Eros argued that a related group entity, 14 Reels Plus LLP, was trying to release the film to sidestep the award.

items.summary: In a world saturated with dramatic disaster news, social media gets suffused with earnest messages of concern. Yet, they’re often misplaced, misdirected at those who aren’t in any danger, or worse, a distraction for anyone in the thick of a crisis.

Financials, however, acted as a drag on the broader market.

items.summary: RBI MPC meeting: As the Reserve Bank of India considers a potential rate cut, experts suggest that retail liquidity constraints and market sentiment may dampen any positive reactions.

items.summary: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee is reviewing rates from December 3-5, with a decision on rate cuts expected tomorrow. Amid low inflation and strong growth, attention is on whether the RBI will take cues from a widely-expected US Fed rate cut next week.
